intro: Crepis praemorsa subsp. caucasigena, commonly known as the Caucasian mouse-ear, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grayish-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
